verses.verse: Now it came <S%H1961><s%> about, when <S%H3588><s%> Isaac <S%H3327><s%> was old, <S%H2204><s%> and his eyes <S%H5869><s%> were too <S%H4480><s%> dim <S%H3543><s%> to see, <S%H7200><s%> that he called <S%H7121><s%> his older <S%H1419><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, "My son. <S%H1121><s%>" And he said <S%H559><s%> to him, "Here <S%H2009><s%> I am."
And Isaac said, <S%H559><s%> "Behold <S%H2009><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> I am <S%H2204><s%> old <S%H2204><s%> [and] I do not know <S%H3045><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> of my death. <S%H4194><s%>

"Now <S%H6258><s%> then, please <S%H4994><s%> take <S%H5375><s%> your gear, <S%H3627><s%> your quiver <S%H8522><s%> and your bow, <S%H7198><s%> and go <S%H3318><s%> out to the field <S%H7704><s%> and hunt <S%H6679><s%> game <S%H6718><s%> for me;

and prepare <S%H6213><s%> a savory <S%H4303><s%> dish <S%H4303><s%> for me such <S%H9201><s%> as I love, <S%H157><s%> and bring <S%H935><s%> it to me that I may eat, <S%H398><s%> so <S%H5668><s%> that my soul <S%H5315><s%> may bless <S%H1288><s%> you before <S%H2962><s%> I die. <S%H4191><s%> "

And Rebekah <S%H7259><s%> was listening <S%H8085><s%> while Isaac <S%H3327><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to his son <S%H1121><s%> Esau. <S%H6215><s%> So when Esau <S%H6215><s%> went <S%H1980><s%> to the field <S%H7704><s%> to hunt <S%H6679><s%> for game <S%H6718><s%> to bring <S%H935><s%> [home,]

Rebekah <S%H7259><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her son <S%H1121><s%> Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> "Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I heard <S%H8085><s%> your father speak <S%H1><s%> to your brother <S%H1696><s%> Esau, <S%H251><s%> saying, <S%H6215><s%>

'Bring <S%H935><s%> me [some] game <S%H6718><s%> and prepare <S%H6213><s%> a savory <S%H4303><s%> dish <S%H4303><s%> for me, that I may eat, <S%H398><s%> and bless <S%H1288><s%> you in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> my death. <S%H4194><s%>'
"Now <S%H6258><s%> therefore, my son, <S%H1121><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me as I command <S%H6680><s%> you.

"Go <S%H1980><s%> now <S%H4994><s%> to the flock <S%H6629><s%> and bring <S%H3947><s%> me two <S%H8147><s%> choice <S%H2896><s%> kids <S%H1423><s%> <S%H5795><s%> from there, <S%H8033><s%> that I may prepare <S%H6213><s%> them [as] a savory <S%H4303><s%> dish <S%H4303><s%> for your father, such <S%H1><s%> as he loves. <S%H9201><s%>
"Then you shall bring <S%H935><s%> [it] to your father, that he may eat, <S%H1><s%> so <S%H398><s%> that he may bless <S%H5668><s%> you before <S%H1288><s%> his death. <S%H6440><s%>"

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> answered <S%H559><s%> his mother <S%H517><s%> Rebekah, <S%H7259><s%> "Behold, <S%H2005><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%> my brother <S%H251><s%> is a hairy <S%H9617><s%> man <S%H376><s%> and I am a smooth <S%H2509><s%> man. <S%H376><s%>

"Perhaps <S%H194><s%> my father will feel <S%H1><s%> me, then I shall be as a deceiver <S%H4959><s%> in his sight; <S%H8591><s%> and I shall bring <S%H5869><s%> upon myself a curse <S%H935><s%> and not a blessing. <S%H7045><s%>"

But his mother <S%H517><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, "Your curse <S%H7045><s%> be on me, my son; <S%H1121><s%> only <S%H389><s%> obey <S%H8085><s%> my voice, <S%H6963><s%> and go, <S%H1980><s%> get <S%H3947><s%> [them] for me."

So he went <S%H1980><s%> and got <S%H3947><s%> [them,] and brought <S%H935><s%> [them] to his mother; <S%H517><s%> and his mother <S%H517><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> savory <S%H4303><s%> food <S%H4303><s%> such <S%H9201><s%> as his father loved. <S%H1><s%>

Then Rebekah <S%H7259><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the best <S%H9143><s%> garments <S%H899><s%> of Esau <S%H6215><s%> her elder <S%H1419><s%> son, <S%H1121><s%> which <S%H834><s%> were with her in the house, <S%H1004><s%> and put <S%H3847><s%> them on Jacob <S%H3290><s%> her younger <S%H6996><s%> son. <S%H1121><s%>
And she put <S%H3847><s%> the skins <S%H5785><s%> of the kids <S%H1423><s%> <S%H5795><s%> on his hands <S%H3027><s%> and on the smooth <S%H9142><s%> part <S%H9142><s%> of his neck. <S%H6677><s%>
She also gave <S%H5414><s%> the savory <S%H4303><s%> food <S%H4303><s%> and the bread, <S%H3899><s%> which <S%H834><s%> she had made, <S%H6213><s%> to her son <S%H1121><s%> Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>
Then he came <S%H935><s%> to his father and said, <S%H1><s%> "My father." And he said, <S%H559><s%> "Here <S%H1><s%> I am. Who <S%H559><s%> are you, my son <S%H2009><s%>?"

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his father, "I am Esau <S%H1><s%> your first-born; I have done <S%H6215><s%> as you told <S%H6213><s%> me. Get <S%H1696><s%> up, please, <S%H6965><s%> sit <S%H4994><s%> and eat <S%H3427><s%> of my game, <S%H398><s%> that you may bless <S%H6718><s%> me."

And Isaac <S%H3327><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his son, <S%H1121><s%> "How <S%H4100><s%> is it that you have <S%H4672><s%> [it] so quickly, <S%H4116><s%> my son <S%H1121><s%>?" And he said, <S%H559><s%> "Because <S%H3588><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> caused [it] to happen <S%H7136><s%> to me."

Then Isaac <S%H3327><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> "Please <S%H4994><s%> come <S%H5066><s%> close, <S%H5066><s%> that I may feel <S%H4184><s%> you, my son, <S%H1121><s%> whether you are really <S%H2088><s%> my son <S%H1121><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%> or <S%H518><s%> not."

So Jacob <S%H3290><s%> came <S%H5066><s%> close <S%H5066><s%> to Isaac <S%H3327><s%> his father, and he felt <S%H1><s%> him and said, <S%H4959><s%> "The voice <S%H559><s%> is the voice <S%H6963><s%> of Jacob, <S%H6963><s%> but the hands <S%H3290><s%> are the hands <S%H3027><s%> of Esau. <S%H3027><s%>"

And he did not recognize <S%H5234><s%> him, because <S%H3588><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> were hairy <S%H9617><s%> like his brother <S%H251><s%> Esau's hands; <S%H3027><s%> so he blessed <S%H1288><s%> him.
And he said, <S%H559><s%> "Are you really <S%H2088><s%> my son <S%H1121><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%>?" And he said, <S%H559><s%> "I am."

So he said, <S%H559><s%> "Bring <S%H5066><s%> [it] to me, and I will eat <S%H398><s%> of my son's game, <S%H6718><s%> that I may bless <S%H1288><s%> you." And he brought <S%H5066><s%> [it] to him, and he ate; <S%H398><s%> he also brought <S%H935><s%> him wine <S%H3196><s%> and he drank. <S%H8354><s%>
Then his father Isaac <S%H1><s%> said <S%H3327><s%> to him, "Please <S%H559><s%> come <S%H4994><s%> close <S%H5066><s%> and kiss <S%H5066><s%> me, my son. <S%H5401><s%>"

So he came <S%H5066><s%> close <S%H5066><s%> and kissed <S%H5401><s%> him; and when he smelled <S%H9552><s%> the smell <S%H7381><s%> of his garments, <S%H899><s%> he blessed <S%H1288><s%> him and said, <S%H559><s%> "See, <S%H7200><s%> the smell <S%H7381><s%> of my son <S%H1121><s%> Is like the smell <S%H7381><s%> of a field <S%H7704><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has blessed; <S%H1288><s%>

Now may God <S%H430><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> you of the dew <S%H2919><s%> of heaven, <S%H8064><s%> And of the fatness <S%H9614><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> And an abundance <S%H7230><s%> of grain <S%H1715><s%> and new <S%H8492><s%> wine; <S%H8492><s%>

May peoples <S%H5971><s%> serve <S%H5647><s%> you, And nations <S%H3816><s%> bow <S%H7812><s%> down <S%H7812><s%> to you; Be master <S%H1376><s%> of your brothers, <S%H251><s%> And may your mother's sons <S%H1121><s%> bow <S%H7812><s%> down <S%H7812><s%> to you. Cursed <S%H779><s%> be those who curse <S%H779><s%> you, And blessed <S%H1288><s%> be those who bless <S%H1288><s%> you."

Now it came <S%H1961><s%> about, as soon <S%H9201><s%> as Isaac <S%H3327><s%> had finished <S%H3615><s%> blessing <S%H1288><s%> Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> had hardly <S%H389><s%> <S%H3318><s%> gone <S%H3318><s%> out from the presence <S%H6440><s%> of Isaac <S%H3327><s%> his father, that Esau <S%H1><s%> his brother <S%H6215><s%> came <S%H251><s%> in from his hunting. <S%H935><s%>

Then he also <S%H1571><s%> made <S%H6213><s%> savory <S%H4303><s%> food, <S%H4303><s%> and brought <S%H935><s%> it to his father; and he said <S%H1><s%> to his father, "Let my father arise, <S%H559><s%> and eat <S%H1><s%> of his son's game, <S%H1><s%> that you may bless <S%H6965><s%> me."
And Isaac <S%H3327><s%> his father said <S%H1><s%> to him, "Who <S%H559><s%> are you?" And he said, <S%H4310><s%> "I am your son, <S%H559><s%> your first-born, Esau. <S%H1121><s%>"

Then Isaac <S%H3327><s%> trembled <S%H2729><s%> violently <S%H2731><s%> <S%H1419><s%>, <S%H5704><s%> <S%H3966><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Who <S%H4310><s%> was he then <S%H645><s%> that hunted <S%H6679><s%> game <S%H6718><s%> and brought <S%H935><s%> [it] to me, so that I ate <S%H398><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> [of it] before <S%H2962><s%> you came, <S%H935><s%> and blessed <S%H1288><s%> him? Yes, <S%H1571><s%> and he shall be blessed. <S%H1288><s%>"

When Esau <S%H6215><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> the words <S%H1697><s%> of his father, he cried <S%H1><s%> out with an exceedingly <S%H6817><s%> great <S%H3966><s%> and bitter <S%H1419><s%> cry, <S%H4751><s%> and said <S%H6818><s%> to his father, "Bless <S%H559><s%> me, [even] me also, <S%H1><s%> O my father!"
And he said, <S%H559><s%> "Your brother <S%H251><s%> came <S%H935><s%> deceitfully, <S%H4820><s%> and has taken <S%H3947><s%> away your blessing. <S%H1293><s%>"

Then he said, <S%H559><s%> "Is he not rightly named <S%H7121><s%> <S%H8034><s%> Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> for he has supplanted <S%H6117><s%> me these <S%H2088><s%> two <S%H6471><s%> times <S%H6471><s%>? He took <S%H3947><s%> away my birthright, <S%H1062><s%> and behold, <S%H2009><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> he has taken <S%H3947><s%> away my blessing. <S%H1293><s%>" And he said, <S%H559><s%> "Have you not reserved <S%H680><s%> a blessing <S%H1293><s%> for me?"

But Isaac <S%H3327><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to Esau, <S%H6215><s%> "Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I have made <S%H7760><s%> him your master, <S%H1376><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> his relatives <S%H251><s%> I have given <S%H5414><s%> to him as servants; <S%H5650><s%> and with grain <S%H1715><s%> and new <S%H8492><s%> wine <S%H8492><s%> I have sustained <S%H5564><s%> him. Now as for you then, <S%H645><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> can I do, <S%H6213><s%> my son <S%H1121><s%>?"

And Esau <S%H6215><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to his father, "Do you have only one <S%H1><s%> blessing, <S%H259><s%> my father? Bless <S%H1293><s%> me, [even] me also, <S%H1><s%> O my father." So Esau <S%H1288><s%> lifted <S%H1571><s%> his voice <S%H1><s%> and wept. <S%H6215><s%>

Then Isaac <S%H3327><s%> his father answered <S%H1><s%> and said <S%H6030><s%> to him, "Behold, <S%H559><s%> away from the fertility <S%H2009><s%> of the earth <S%H9614><s%> shall be your dwelling, <S%H776><s%> And away from the dew <S%H4186><s%> of heaven <S%H2919><s%> from above. <S%H8064><s%>

"And by your sword <S%H2719><s%> you shall live, <S%H2421><s%> And your brother <S%H251><s%> you shall serve; <S%H5647><s%> But it shall come <S%H1961><s%> about when <S%H9201><s%> you become <S%H7300><s%> restless, <S%H7300><s%> That you shall break <S%H6561><s%> his yoke <S%H5923><s%> from your neck. <S%H6677><s%>"

So Esau <S%H6215><s%> bore <S%H7852><s%> a grudge <S%H7852><s%> against <S%H7852><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> of the blessing <S%H1293><s%> with which <S%H834><s%> his father had blessed <S%H1><s%> him; and Esau <S%H1288><s%> said <S%H6215><s%> to himself, <S%H559><s%> "The days <S%H3820><s%> of mourning <S%H3117><s%> for my father are near; <S%H60><s%> then I will kill <S%H1><s%> my brother <S%H7126><s%> Jacob. <S%H2026><s%>"

Now when the words <S%H1697><s%> of her elder <S%H1419><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%> were reported <S%H5046><s%> to Rebekah, <S%H7259><s%> she sent <S%H7971><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> her younger <S%H6996><s%> son <S%H1121><s%> Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> to him, "Behold <S%H2009><s%> your brother <S%H251><s%> Esau <S%H6215><s%> is consoling <S%H5162><s%> himself concerning you, [by planning] to kill <S%H2026><s%> you.

"Now <S%H6258><s%> therefore, my son, <S%H1121><s%> obey <S%H8085><s%> my voice, <S%H6963><s%> and arise, <S%H6965><s%> flee <S%H1272><s%> to Haran, <S%H2771><s%> to my brother <S%H251><s%> Laban! <S%H3837><s%>
"And stay <S%H3427><s%> with him a few <S%H259><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> <S%H834><s%> your brother's fury <S%H2534><s%> subsides, <S%H7725><s%>

until <S%H5704><s%> your brother's anger <S%H639><s%> against <S%H4480><s%> you subsides, <S%H7725><s%> and he forgets <S%H7911><s%> what <S%H834><s%> you did <S%H6213><s%> to him. Then I shall send <S%H7971><s%> and get <S%H3947><s%> you from there. <S%H8033><s%> Why <S%H4100><s%> should I be bereaved <S%H7921><s%> of you both <S%H8147><s%> in one <S%H259><s%> day <S%H3117><s%>? "

And Rebekah <S%H7259><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> "I am tired <S%H6973><s%> of living <S%H9132><s%> because <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> of the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Heth; <S%H2845><s%> if <S%H518><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%> takes <S%H3947><s%> a wife <S%H802><s%> from the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Heth, <S%H2845><s%> like these, <S%H428><s%> from the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> good will my life <S%H9132><s%> be to me?"
